Comments_List: Professor Valis SPAN 711 La Regenta & Fortunata y Jacinta extensively and comprehensively developed and sophisticated students knowledge, concerning literary realism in nineteenth century Spain and the multidisciplinary implications of literary realism itself. As such, this course enabled students to analyze two monumental nineteenth century realist Spanish novelsLa Regenta and Fortunata y Jacintain a multidimensional and intertextual manner and thus hone their analytical skills with respect to nineteenth century Spanish realist novels. The variously appearing thematic of sociocultural crises that arose and/or were conceptualized as existent within nineteenth century Spain and their apparent/evident reflections within these aforementioned novels consisted of one of the principal themes of discussion of this course, which truly augmented its students analytical and intertextual perspectives concerning nineteenth century Spains literary realism.

Professor Valis course truly enables students to acquire and utilize essential analytical and literary skills with respect to nineteenth century Spains literary realism, via its comprehensive and diverse demonstration of the profound and immense literary and sociocultural consequences of this literary genre. For instance, Professor Valis kindly explicated the various literary, historical, religious and political tendencies incorporated within these novels and thus enabled students to analyze even one passage of a particular realist novel from various perspectives. Furthermore, this courses centralizing itself upon two nineteenth century Spanish realist novels by two different authors enabled students to practice much intertextual and comparative analyses. This course additionally developed students literary perspectives, via comparing, contrasting and evaluating different works of literary analyses of these two novels, ranging from those contemporaneous with the novels themselves to recent studies.

Indeed, I would most definitely recommend this course, since Professor Valis ensures that her students learn and acquire diverse literary and analytical skills and perspectives, concerning nineteenth century Spanish literary realism and literary realism itself. Professor Valis course will introduce students to the varied and immense significance of literary realism within nineteenth century Spain and in fact in various western literatures, and thus sophisticate and culminate students literary and analytical experiences. Therefore, Professor Valis course will most definitely deepen and sophisticate all students knowledge, perspectives and conceptualizations of nineteenth century Spanish literary realism and of literary realism itself.
